edu.stanford.nlp.trees

Interface TreeTransformer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTreebankParserParams.RemoveGFSubcategoryStripper, AbstractTreebankParserParams.SubcategoryStripper, ArabicTreebankParserParams.ArabicSubcategoryStripper, ArabicTreeNormalizer, ATBCorrector, BasicCategoryTreeTransformer, BobChrisTreeNormalizer, BoundaryRemover, ChineseCollinizer, CollinsPuncTransformer, CompositeTreeTransformer, CoordinationTransformer, CTBErrorCorrectingTreeNormalizer, DateTreeTransformer, Debinarizer, DependencyTreeTransformer, EnglishTreebankParserParams.EnglishSubcategoryStripper, FrenchTreeNormalizer, FTBCorrector, HebrewTreeNormalizer, NPTmpRetainingTreeNormalizer, QPTreeTransformer, RecursiveTreeTransformer, SpanishTreeNormalizer, SynchronizedTreeTransformer, TreeAnnotator, TreeAnnotatorAndBinarizer, TreeBinarizer, TreeCollinizer, TreeLeafLabelTransformer

    public interface TreeTransformer
    This is a simple interface for a function that alters a local Tree.
    Author:
    Christopher Manning.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Tree transformTree(Tree t)
      Does whatever one needs to do to a particular tree.

    • Method Detail

      • transformTree

        Tree transformTree(Tree t)
        Does whatever one needs to do to a particular tree. This routine is passed a whole Tree, and could itself work recursively, but the canonical usage is to invoke this method via the Tree.transform() method, which will apply the transformer in a bottom-up manner to each local Tree, and hence the implementation of TreeTransformer should merely examine and change a local (one-level) Tree.
        Parameters:
        t - A tree. Classes implementing this interface can assume that the tree passed in is not null.
        Returns:
        the transformed Tree
